intro: Ostericum grosseserratum, commonly known as the roughleaf tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ostericum grosseserratum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and unique appearance make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
